alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 8:53AM CDT until May 17 at 4:49PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lavaca River near Edna. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins with the river one third of a mile wide near the Highway 59 bridge flooding secondary roads and bridges along the river. Livestock are isolated and potentially drown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.5 feet. - Though river levels at this gage have recently fallen below flood stage after the last bout of heavy rainfall, a new round of rains this weekend will cause the river to rise again above flood stage. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 26.4 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.4 feet on 09/23/1967. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Lavaca River Edna 21.0 19.5 Sat 6 am CDT 20.0 26.4 24.6 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.
